sentence.Network_en: He is entranced by the kindness of her smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被她和善的微笑迷住了。

sentence.Network_en: I became entranced with the idea.

sentence.Network_cn: 他听她讲话听得出了神。

PerfectNetExp.abs: intruder n. 侵入者，不请自来者entranced a. 出神的monstrous a. 极大的，可怕的
The children watched entranced as the circus animals performed., 马戏团的动物表演时 , 孩子们都看得出神.
She was entranced to see him perform ., 他表演时她看得出了神.

核能专业词汇英语翻译(DE) ... entrainment filter 收集过滤器 entrance angle 入射角 entrance pressure drop 进口压降.
希高翻译-经济词汇中英对照二十 ... 磨蚀 Erosion 入境签证 Entrance Visa 押运 Escort.

entry.def: The entrance to a place is the way into it, for example a door or gate.

example.ex: Beside the entrance to the church, turn right...
He was driven out of a side entrance with his hand covering his face...
example.tran: 他被从侧门赶了出来，一只手还捂着脸。

entry.tran: 到达;（尤指有意引人注目的）驾到，莅临
entry.def: You can refer to someone's arrival in a place as their entrance, especially when you think that they are trying to be noticed and admired.

example.ex: If she had noticed her father's entrance, she gave no indication.
example.tran: 就算她已经注意到了父亲的到来，她也会不动声色。

entry.def: When a performer makes his or her entrance on to the stage, he or she comes on to the stage.

example.ex: He made his entrance into the parade ring.

entry.def: If you gain entrance to a particular place, you manage to get in there.

example.ex: Hewitt had gained entrance to the Hall by pretending to be a heating engineer.
example.tran: 休伊特装扮成供热工程师从而进入大厅。

entry.tran: 入会资格;入学资格;入行资格
entry.def: If you gain entrance to a particular profession, society, or institution, you are accepted as a member of it.

example.ex: Entrance to universities and senior secondary schools was restricted.
example.tran: 进入大学或高中的资格受到限制。

example.ex: ...entrance exams for the French civil service.

entry.def: If you make an entrance into a particular activity or system, you succeed in becoming involved in it.

example.ex: The acquisition helped BCCI make its initial entrance into the US market.
example.tran: 那项并购帮助国际商业信贷银行首次跻身美国市场。

entry.def: If something or someone entrances you, they cause you to feel delight and wonder, often so that all your attention is taken up and you cannot think about anything else.

example.ex: As soon as I met Dick, he entranced me because he has a lovely voice...
example.tran: 我一遇到迪克，就被他那动听的声音迷住了。

example.ex: Last Friday she entranced the audience with her classical Indian singing.
example.tran: 上周五她演唱的经典印度歌曲让听众如痴如醉。

auth_sentence.content: Pretty girls, with brains and laughter, entranced him.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pretty girls, with brains and laughter, entranced him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pretty girls, with brains and laughter, entranced him.

auth_sentence.content: A shaman, an entranced wizard whose spirit is in mystical flight.
auth_sentence.res_content: A shaman, an entranced wizard whose spirit is in mystical flight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A shaman, an entranced wizard whose spirit is in mystical flight.

auth_sentence.content: Engrossed, entranced, he forgot about time, and about humanity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Engrossed, entranced, he forgot about time, and about humanity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Engrossed, entranced, he forgot about time, and about humanity.
